parents and her husband.`` We were telling her how proud we were of her and how she was inspiring the whole nation with her courage and with her strength,'' Kirsten Gillibrand said. Then Debbie Wasserman Schultz and I started joking about all the things we were going to do when she got better. We were holding her hand, and she was responding to our hand-holding, she was rubbing her hands and she was gripping our hands so we could... we knew she could hear and understand what we were saying, she moved her leg. We knew she was responding. The lawmakers continued to joke about what they were going to do together, and as they did so, Gabrielle Giffords `` started to open her eyes, literally,'' Kirsten Gillibrand said. , head of Egypt's antiquities department. They climbed over walls, forced open doors and entered the museum's vast souvenir shop.`` I'm glad that those people were idiots,'' Zahi Hawass told TIME. They looted the museum shop. Thank God they thought that the museum shop was the museum. The Egyptian Museum itself is extraordinary, the repository of many of the country's greatest ancient treasures, including those from Tutankhamun's tomb, which take up nearly half of the second floor. `` State of the Union'' Sunday, Colin Powell said the meeting between Hu Jintao and Barack Obama resulted in some successful trade deals; however, it probably would not do much to alter Beijing's human-right policies. They are going to remain an authoritarian nation, Colin Powell said.`` They believe that's the only way they can run a nation of 1.3 billion people, and they haven't done badly in recent years.'' Allen Iverson 's still hurting Former All-Star Allen Iverson , 35, could miss the rest of the regular season and the playoffs with Turkish team Besiktas because of painful calcium deposits in his calf. He tried to tough it out and continue to play while over in Turkey, said Dr. James Andrews, who added Allen Iverson needs at least 6-8 weeks of rest.`` However, he got to the point where he could not really run up and down the court.'' At practice Wednesday, Michael Vick loosened up throwing passes to Falcons quarterback Matt Ryan, who is making his first Pro Bowl appearance in his third season and succeeded Michael Vick in Atlanta. Matt is great. The coaching staff is great. We're just having a good time, he said.`` I like what they're doing in the offense and it's been easy.
